area_name: Way of the Wah (AKA the cave)

content.description: Maybe the best problem when its not wet. Start on rail and bust a move out the roof on positive holds. Save energy for a tricky ending...
content.protection: Depends on sand levels. Low sand exposes rocky outcroppings and high sand is soft, smooth landings. Bring pads and check for a dry, low tide day. This climb is totally safe and does not warrant a PG13 rating.
content.location: Located in the cave opposite the "danger boulder" (Orange Buddha Boulder).  Start matched on rail.

content.description:
Maybe the best independent moderate since the Danger Rock shifted in 2017, but still only two/three moves. Start sitting with right hand on high sharp crimp, left hand undercling low. Using a cool left drop-knee, go left to decent crimp, working up to jugs. Top out on highball choss (easy but sketchy), or just drop off from highest solid jugs.

This problem is likely to keep evolving if more people climb it and knock choss off. If anyone knows an actual name for this problem, I'll update it.
content.location: Overhanging grey face, facing nude beach.

pathTokens: Way of the Wah (AKA the cave)
